title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: Frederick S. Tukey to W. H. Woodbury, September 21, 1865
summary: Tukey writes on behalf of two teachers, a Miss McLeane and a Mrs. Dunn, and pleads for the Bureau to not overlook the Shenandoah Valley where there has been no schooling at all (presumably for newly freed slaves).
keywords: Education, Women, Church/Religious Activity, American Civil War
